Header: PM will leave for Singapore on Sunday to attend the Sixth World Cities Conference
Content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe is due to leave for Singapore on Sunday. He will be attending the Sixth World Cities Summit there. Parallel to this conference, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe is due to participate in the Singapore International water week and Clean Environment Summit Singapore 2018. During his visit Prime Minister Wickremasinghe is due to meet Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong, Deputy Prime Minister Tharman Shanmugaratnam, and Former Prime Minister Goh Chok Tong and high level dignitaries of the Singapore Government. Premier Wickremasinghe will deliver the keynote address on the 09 th at the Summit to be held at the Sands Expo & Convention Centre covering the insight, trends and solutions concerning urban development and environment protection. The theme for this yearâ€™s Summit will be Liveable & Sustainable Cities: Embracing the future through innovation and collaboration. The Summit will explore how cities can be more liveable and resilient through better Governance and planning, technology and social innovations as well as collaborations with various stake holders and with other cities. The Prime Minister will be accompanied by Prof. Maithri Wickremasinghe, Ministers Rauff Hakeem, Sajith Premadasa and Malik Samarawickrema and Deputy Minister Anoma Gamage.
